frame.name: Military
frame.definition: <def-root>Some <fen>Possessor</fen>, either a nation, institution, or private individual, controls a <fen>Force</fen> whose primary functions to defend the <fen>Possessor</fen> (or, in the case of an institution or individual, some area of land significant to them) and to carry out offensive actions for the <fen>Possessor</fen>. The <fen>Domain</fen> of operation of the <fen>Force</fen> may be expressed.</def-root>

FE.name: Force
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Force</fen> is the body of soldiers that acts in military capacity for the <fen>Possessor</fen>.
<ex>Large ground-based <fex name="for"><t>forces</t></fex> will attack to defeat and fix the enemy's front line.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Possessor
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Possessor</fen> is the nation, institution, or individual who possesses and/or controls the <fen>Force</fen>.
<ex>The American invasion, which drew 26000 American troops against <fex name="pos">General Noriega's</fex> <t>army</t>, was the largest US military operation since Vietnam.</ex> <ex>Unfortunately, <fex name="pos">They</fex> don't <m>have</m> a very strong <t>army</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>A characterization of the <fen>Force</fen>.
<ex>And while Serbia is keen to invest in its <fex name="des">dilapidated</fex> <t>armed</t> <t>forces</t>, Montenegro wants to introduce a 4000-strong professional army.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Members
FE.definition:
<def-root>The consituent members of the <fen>Force</fen>.
<ex>The US has an entirely <fex name="mem">citizen</fex> <t>army</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Domain
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Domain</fen> in which the <fen>Force</fen> operates.
<ex>The Persians originally planned to rely solely on their <fex name="dom">land</fex> <t>army</t> to advance beyond Athens.</ex> <ex>You seem to think that our intelligence and <fex name="dom">covert ops</fex> <t>forces</t> and our military are only able to conduct one mission at a time.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Goal
FE.definition:
<def-root>A (permanent or temporary) <fen>Goal</fen> of the <fen>Force</fen>.
<ex>Right at this time of emergency, the <fex name="goa">revolutionary</fex> <t>army</t> made one attack after another in their rear, thus adding to their confusion.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Period_of_existence
FE.definition: <def-root>The length of time that the particular military organization has existed.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: military.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the armed forces, particularly of a nation.

lexUnit.name: force.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an organized body of military personnel, police, or workers.

lexUnit.name: navy.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the branch of the armed services that operates at sea.

lexUnit.name: air force.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a branch of the armed forces concerned with fighting or defence in the air.

lexUnit.name: army.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an organized military force equipped for fighting on land.

lexUnit.name: naval.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: of, in, or relating to a navy or navies.

lexUnit.name: armed forces.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the army, navy, and air force.

lexUnit.name: military.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: of, relating to, or characteristic of soldiers or armed forces.

lexUnit.name: military forces.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the army, navy, etc. of a nation.

lexUnit.name: national guard.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: the branch of the armed services that functions more like a militia - is more of a reserve force, and is capable of functioning in both military and law enforcement situations
